data.title: Bill Text: NY K02401
data.meta_description: 2023 NY K02401 (Text) Commending Bob Olson for a lifetime of dedicated service to the Town of Horicon, New York
data.text: Assembly Resolution No. 2401 BY: M. of A. Simpson COMMENDING Bob Olson for a lifetime of dedicated service to the Town of Horicon, New York WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and serve the best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and cannot be sufficiently extolled; and WHEREAS, Bob Olson has given not only of his time and energies but also of his competence, intelligence, and leadership and consequently has been designated for special honor for a lifetime of dedicated service to the Town of Horicon, New York; and WHEREAS, Bob Olson has been called upon to contribute his time and talents to countless civic and charitable endeavors and has always given of himself unstintingly; throughout the entire period of his community service, a period of constructive involvement, Bob Olson has stood constant in dignity and good grace; and WHEREAS, With his wife, Jean, Bob Olson built a vacation home on Brant Lake in 1970; two years later, they became full-time residents; as a permanent resident of Horicon, this selfless and dedicated man served as a local Boy Scout leader for many years; and WHEREAS, From 1976-2012, Bob Olson was the owner of Olson Contracting, building homes in the Adirondack Region for more than 35 years and providing employment for many local residents; from 1977-1982, he was Chairman of the Town of Horicon's Planning Board; and WHEREAS, As a Member of Horicon's Planning Board, Bob Olson was appointed as Town Board Representative to the Planning Commission, to review the Town's Comprehensive Master Plan, from 1974-1982; and WHEREAS, From 1988-2010, Bob Olson was a Member and Director of the New York State Builders Association, also serving as President and Chairman of the Board and participating in the Research and Education Foundation (REF), a leading non-profit organization which guides students in home-building and construction-related fields of study and provides scholarships; and WHEREAS, During his tenure as a Member and Director of the Executive Committee for the Builders and Remodelers Association of Northern New York (BRANNY), from 1988-2003, Bob Olson served as President from 1991-1994 and from 2001-2003; and WHEREAS, Bob Olson was appointed by New York State Governor George Pataki as a Member of the New York State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council where he proudly served for six years; from 2002-2024, he fulfilled the role of Councilman for Horicon's Town Board, recently resigning; and WHEREAS, Participating in projects for the Town of Horicon on a pro bono basis, Bob Olson has been a pillar of his community and this great Empire State; he has also been an invaluable asset to the construction industry; of the numerous projects throughout the years, the coordination and building of Horicon's landfill facility which utilized volunteer labor, supplied by local contractors and the Town of Horicon Highway Department, made him quite proud; and WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individual for the benefit of others which Bob Olson has displayed throughout his life; now, therefore, be it RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause in its deliberations to commend Bob Olson for a lifetime of dedicated service to the Town of Horicon, New York; and be it further RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be transmitted to Bob Olson.
